comments.text: Perfect spot! I never havr to wait longer than 15 min to catch a ride.
Great for cars to Utrecht or Arnhem
Super good spot especially if you want to go to utrecht or amsterdam
I agree, very friendly people. We got a car very fast and the man was nice. He even borowed us his phone and took us exactly where we needed.
I just wait 5 min and it was not during the rush hours. Maybe i was lucky but it's true that people are very friendly there !
Waited two minutes before getting picked up to Heerenveen
got ride to Harlingen within 20 min
Agree with other reviews. Got a ride within 20 min to Heerenveen.
Got a ride to Zwolle within 5 mins. Brilliant spot just behind traffic lights, drivers spot you quickly while they're still getting back to full speed. They can easily reach you at the bus stop.

Very good spot to hitch from, cars start from the traffic light from two directions and can see you easily because they don't drive too fast yet. Former official hitchhikers spot. Better than the petrol station down the road, because they usually don't like hitchhikers "bothering" the drivers.
Great spot, hitched here twice alway found a car to Antwerp/Belgium in half an hour

For the first time ever, an employee asked me (friendly) to ask a ride on the parking behind the gas station, because people would get uncomfortable. Well, I get uncomfortable of these shitty rules and people who believe all hitchhikers are murderers and rapists. The first car I asked drove me to Antwerp.
hithchiked directly to paris from here (a few times). Many dutch lease cars fill up their gas here because they are not allowed to get gas for free outside holland.
Saw an English car outside the McDonald's. Waited for them to return to car and they took me to Dunkerque for the ferry.
Got a ride (for 2 people) straight into Antwerp city centre within 10 mins. Huge petrol station, toilets and food etc. also available.
use it often for Zwolle, good spot but sometimes the staff is anoyed by HH. just do your thing and send love :)

It seems to depend whether gas station personnel sends you away or not. I was once told to stand behind the gas station, but other times it was no problem standing in front of it. Either way, a good place to catch a ride to at least the first gas station on the A1 towards Germany.
Pretty good place to go east. I was here in the dark on an early Monday morning in January (during rush hour) and didn't get sent away. Found a ride to Osnabrück in about 20-30 minutes.

I have a different experience: Lots of people going east towards Hengelo/Germany. Not so many heading north, but still very doable to find somebody in that direction, even late at night. No problems with employees for me.

Very good for directions North. Directions west and east are more difficult.
Shell gas station with personal saying you can't hitch from the gas station "Shell regulations" and rather have to stand somewhere else. I would suggest first (making trouble) and continue anyway, if they really start to threat then stand right at the entrance (or at the exit) of this P- place.

Lots of people were offering rides to various parts of Ams, but we had time and decided to wait for someone going into center of Amsterdam. In the end we got amazing ride in a beautiful oldschool car of some guy living in the center of Amsterdam.
Chatted to people at petrol station. Not much traffic but got lucky and got lift all the way to Dusseldorf.
Nice spot. We even recycled some pretty decent food from the restaurant on the bridge
After asking a few (approx. 10) drivers for a ride, we got one within 15 minutes

Excellent place to get out if you do not want to go into Amsterdam but rather towards the east. Try to get a ride at least to the A1, which is the main road that ends up going to the east. Once you are on the A'dam Ring, it can be hard to find such a ride. Also a good spot to go into A'dam ofcourse.
Nice spot. A lot of place And good way to go to Amsterdam/Utrecht

Good spot for Utrecht.
I was waiting here for 10 minutes.
5 min. to UTRECH althought the lady was going to GRONINGEN.
Utrecht. A27 access lane 15. Bus 31 stop â€œMinervum 1200â€, 750 m SW Minervum. Hard shoulder on sliproad.
With Brussel panel, got a ride in 5 min to Breda
That was great!)
Be aware that standing behind the highway sign is a pretty hefty fine... Still my fav spot
I always use this when I leave Delft direction R'dam(south)
Good traffic, people both going west and south.

Utrecht, Den
Haag, â€™s-
Hertogenbosch,
Eindhoven,
Maastricht. Fuel station on
A12/A50 between
access lane 26 and
access lane 25 â€œDe
Schaarsâ€ (4 km). Bus 2 stop â€œMuseum 40 45â€
(Schaarsbergen), 300 m SE verge
A12/A50 Ns (fence?). 25 min.Fuel station on the
motorway. Ns.
We were standing just after the traffic lights, on the onramp. Got a lift to a petrolstation on the A1, which was good!
Now my preferred on-ramp eastbound from Deventer :)
On-ramp 24 Deventer-Oost, A1 towards Hengelo/Enschede/Germany. Recently reconstructed, but seems to be good.
got a ride to The Hague in 8 minutes on a saturday morning
This gasstation is very large and busy and you can very easily find rides to Rotterdam, The Hague and Leiden. Even late at night it is easy here.
Getting here from Vliegveldstraat (N737): leave the viaduct on the SE side, down to the highway, and under the bridge. The grass is quite wide so it should be safe.
Best spot to get over the fence
Very good spot, busstop helps cars to stop savely
Very good spot with save place to stop
So quick, great spot
Good spot, lots of traffic, sign recommend but doable by thumb as well
Nice spot for getting a ride to Arnhem and further with huge space where even trucks can (and will) stop.
Ride to Amsterdam, 4 minutes, thumb
Good spot, hirched by thumb got a ride to Rotterdam. May also be good gor going towards Barnevels
Always a good place towards Hengelo. Waiting time during evening (dark) most times 10-60 min.
Stood next to the traffic light going to Liege, got picked up very quickly. If you’re going south you could make a sign for both Aachen and Liege
It was under 15 minutes, got picked by a young couple who took us to a train station on their way. Our first stop, to reach bremen(through zwolle)
Just asked the ppl on the gas station
Was wrting a sign to use at the onramp, but a man saw me writing it and offered me a ride.

Very good spot to stand at. Cars have the time to stop at the bus stop.
Got a ride to Deventer from here but also a good spot to start from to go to Germany
You can ask people at the backside of the station if they go to Bergen. Many people drop people of at this place, or pick them up, once a train arrives
Nice woman picked me up after I stood with thumb out at the entrance to the gas station.
After something like 5 minutes we got ride through Belgium to the edge of the France from young couple in electromobile.
I waited for one minute to catch a ride to Nijmegen, about 5 cars have to wait in front of the traffic light, it is easy to step in
Great stop if you are heading down south. Lots of traffic, many families though
the car was going to Kerkrade, but they took me to my front door in Aachen

Bus stop in front of the gas station. Sheltered from the rain under the roof of the station while hitching the passing traffic. Used sign "Enschede". Waited 3 mins for a driver that took a detour to drop me a the station.

Parking bay on the N18. May feel dodgy but people see you from a good distance. Be aware that after Haaksbergen there or no more good hitchhiking places on the N18 so it might make sense to wait a bit longer to find the perfect ride for you direction.
Plenty space.
Pretty decent spot with good traffic towards the A1. I used the pedestrian crossing, but there is also a bus stop nearby that should work well
Top notch spot to go direction Arnhem. Slow driving cars can easilly see you and and they have a perfect busstop to stop. It is a wonderful place! I have been Hitchhiking here more than 100 times.
A good spot for getting East. Got in with a HGV going towards Köln.

It took surprisingly long to find a ride into Rotterdam here, but I eventually found one through asking around at the gas station. Staff there was very friendly and one even offered to take me to Rotterdam if I don't find a lift.
I just this spot at the station regularly when i want to go to Harmelen. The bus comes in 15 minutes, but most of the time i am gone before the bus comes.
On a sunday. At the bus stop. Got a ride to Doetinchem in 1 minute.
If you get dropped of on the parking on either side and want to go into Enschede: Walk along the highway, under the viaduct, than climb it on the other side.
Short ride to the A67.
Only needed to go to the next village. Stood there for 1 minute with the thumb up.
Good spot, lots of traffic

Parking with an info-sign, just after the roundabout. Waited 4 minutes for a ride to Borculo. 
10 minutes from the train station.
I was here in the early morning. Offered a ride to Schiphol by a gentleman going to work at Schiphol.
Amazing spot, a lot of space for cars to stop, you are very visible. Usually guys go in direction of Warsaw

Great spot, both in the direction of Apeldoorn aswell as Arnhem, but I'm sure you can you can easily go other ways to. Some busstops so place to pick up, and a lot of traffic lights so cars are relatively slow
perfect spot for alkmaar; stand in front of the bus entrance
In front of a cafe. Plenty of space.
Bus stop "Hekkehorst".

Exit of the gas station
Going north

Great spot if you need to go towards Utrecht, especially during the morning rush hour. There's a traffic light, and most people turning right will be heading for the N11. There is a small 'inlet' next to the road where a car could stop while not hindering other traffic.
Got a ride to Antwerp fairly quickly.
At a roundabout. Easy to get a ride to Doetinchem.
Lots of traffic, but can be difficult to get to.
a lot of space for cars to stop (empty parking spots) between the road and bike lane. mainly local and regional traffic but you might be able to get a ride to a highway onramp nearby
Good spot at the exit.
Gezellige buurt naast de snelweg richting Amsterdam en schiphol
Ikea parking lot on the way to Ommen
Worked for me in direction Utrecht. Just waited 10 minutes
Good for all directions.
Good place to get out of the city in Drachten direction. Take the bus (14, 28, 94, 95) from train station and get out at Drachtsweg bus stop.
Got a ride to Breda very quickly!
Good spot to get you out of Amsterdam in direction of Utrecht
Great spot to go south. I got a ride within 15 mins to roermond. I had a sign. Oh, and two lovely ladies from the company nearby saw me and brought me some tea and snacks.
Probably the best spot in the Hague, got a ride to Utrecht fairly easily. Its an official Hitchhiking spot so there space to stop. Great start for our journey to Budapest
A relatively good spot for getting to Utrecht (even though the Dutch and the Belgians aren't generally fond of hitchhiking). (1 M, 1 F)
Official hitchhiking spot / bus stop.

We were wondering if this was a good spot for hitch-hiking to Utrech (trying to reach Hamburg  as final destination)  when we saw a guy with a sign to Utrech too. He got a ride in litteraly 1 mimute. We were two with a sign, had to wait for 30min.
Good spot, got a ride to Breda after 5 minutes!

On-ramp

Had to jaywalk through the crossroads to get to the spot but there is space to stop and many people go there during rush hours
On-ramp 33 Assen-West, direction Groningen. Huge hard shoulder
Had one car stop that just went into Doetinchem. Eventually got picked up by a colleague who dropped me off exactly where I needed to go.
Gas station "Fieten olie".
This time traffic coming from the highway seemed to busy so I just hitched the traffic coming from Doetinchemseweg.
The entrance to the highway, traffic lights and lot of space to stop the car.

Kinda hard to reach safely, but the spot in itself is not that bad. You can wait behind the safety barrier after the traffic lights. Got a ride in 5 mn for 2 persons for further than Gent with a “België” sign.
Got picked up after <5 minutes. Plenty of space for cars to pull over.
Good lots of people going to work towards Utrecht
Not a very long wait before we got a lift further south on the A2. We stopd at the exit with a sign and thumbs out.
Got a ride to Eindhoven within a minute

Great spot for going north to Amsterdam, and okay spot to get west to Rotterdam.
Unfortunately the staff of the gas station told me I can't ask drivers for a lift at the gas station itself, so I had to resort to using a sign on the exit of the parking lot. A bit annoying, as the gas station had lots of cars coming through.
I the end, I didn't wait too long and finally found somebody who drove me close to Rotterdam.
to the north, Nijmegen, Arnhem, Apeldoorn, Groningen, Amsterdam - seems to be good to very good place
Pretty good for germany, although not a lot of trafic
Very bad spot. Almost 0 traffic stopping on a Saturday afternoon. It took us a very long time to find a hitchhike to the border of Germany
Got offered a ride to Osnabrück almost immediately, but we had to wait for the car to be charged. In the meantime, we found a ride all the way to Hamburg. Good spot for travelling far into Germany!
Took us a lot to get picked up, but when speaking to people was easier to get a ride to Osnabruck. We are heading towards Berlin.
A little tricky to get there by foot, but once you get there its a very good spot to go to Hannover/Berlin or Hamburg.

got a really fun ride here, a family with two kids in a campervan who would offer me a ride in exchange for babysitting their 3 year old. so i was playing games and drawing with her 'til we reached lux. it was hard to say goodbye hahah! super kind people, hope they're doing well :)
we just came here and asked max 3 cars and we catch one that was going to Brussels where we wanted to go
Got a ride straight to Luxemburg this is te place where people tank if they got a lease contract soo a good place to catch a long ride
It seemed to me this petrol station is very very quiet, almost nobody stops here. Ended up hitching directly on the motorway. Maybe I was just there at the wrong time!
Took the Bus Nr 8 that leaves for example at Boschstraat/Markt. Got off in Eijsden (Village south of M.) at Emmastraat/J S Bach Straat. Cost around 5€.

Tried to get a ride to Aachen, waited about 2 hours and gave up. Instead took a train.
A lot of people travelling to Belgium.
For some reason today (15/08/24) isn't a day for hitchhiking. Had to wait a (very) long time for my other rides as well.
Got a ride from a German lady to Maastricht
Got a direct transfer to Aachen (Germany)

still the best place to go to Tienbaan at Heerlen grens
average 30 minutes

Het Anker is a good place, nice personel, from here you can take a ride to Heerlen-grens servicestation Tienbaan from where you get rides to deep in Germany
Here on Anker watch for German drivers who go to the first exit after the border passing Heerlen-grens Tienbaan, they can drop you on Heerlen-grens Tienbaan

After the bad luck on the official spot in Amsterdam, here we did not even started hitchhiking and guy came asking where we are going and took us all the way behind Groningen. He was himself and experienced hitchhiker.
Definitely an adventure to get there, but quite a lot of traffic. Definitely have a sign with you, most cars stopping did short trips(Monday morning).

Very good place, to get here from amsterdam, make a sign to ‘Almere’, a lot of people from amsterdam go to Almere, this gas station is just before they exit the highway to Almere. (You can add ‘Amersfoort’ on your sign for example…)

Super busy and great if you're heading towards Germany. Was planning to ride the A1 east so turned down two rides going north, but was then offered a ride all the way to Bremen passing through Groningen. Didn't even have to ask drivers just stood by the exit.
Good spot with lots of friendly drivers. Got a lift to Apeldoorn in 20 mins. Bit of a mission to get to the spot but worth it compared to hitching from the official spot back in Amsterdam
No longer good for Utrecht/Amsterdam
Good spot as most drivers see you and there is space to stop.

Used this as a starting place for a hitchhiking competition on a Friday morning in July. Even though we were there with about 12 couples (most with signs to Apeldoorn), everyone was picked up within about 30-40 minutes.
Not as good when it's dark, because it will be more difficult for drivers to see your sign, but still possible. Got a ride to Apeldoorn on a very early Monday morning in January within 20 minutes.
A Real good spot for travelling to the north. I never waited longer than 10 minutes for a ride to Arnhem.
Good place, safe, easy to see you and to stop.
Haven’t had to wait very long here. Have two times hitched a ride to the next gas station on the highway near Nijmegen.
Usually my start, good for direction Nijmegen, Arnhem Or Apeldoorn. Never had to wait longer than 30 min.
The bus stop is a perfect place for Arnhem and Nijmegen!
Arnhem, Nijmegen	. N225 (Ritzema Bosweg) x Diedenweg	. Bus 50/86s/251 stop â€œDiedenwegâ€. Bus stop.
Stood right in the corner between a main road and the turn to gas station. Heavy traffic, got picked up after 40 seconds (possibly luck xd). Real nice spot to Rotterdam.
Asked two people, then left, then the highway is a DEFINITE no go, so walked back and the first person took me - good spot to get to Rot
Shell Gas Station right here, stood in front with sign for Utrecht, maybe got a ride within 30 minutes.  Lots of traffic.
At the bus stop.
Official hitchhiking spot only had to wait for 5 minutes with a sign (Destination Amsterdam)
Great spot. We (2pers) came here at 07.15 AM to get with work traffic. We stood here for 15-20 min and got a ride to Apeldoorn. Make sure you you are seen from across the intersection.
Friendly guy stops right in the middle of the street, I was also red light so he didn’t care much (although, people were honking). Took me straight to Utrecht. Thank you!

Theres some space behind you where cars can park, its a good spot and lots if traffic, especially into the center of Amsterdam! 
Good spot to go to Utrecht :)
We were two (Boy&Girl) and stood there with a sign. 🌱
Pretty quiet at 18 30 on a friday evening, most cars going to Ede, but in 10-15 mins we found a ride to Amsterdam
Ask drivers at gasstation. Smooth sailing
Not too much traffic, not too little traffic, there is a nice space to put a thumb up next to EV charging station.
Staff prefers that hitchhikers go out back to signal for safety reasons. There was not a lot of traffic but I got a ride within minutes
Still my favorite spot to get on the highway.
Possible for all directions (Arnhem/ Enschede/ Germany). Sign might be usefull.
To onramp A18/N18.
Good towards Varsseveld and Enschede.

Good spot, there is a liftershalte 100 meters after the traffic lights, but this makes no sense. Sometimes I wait here too long like 45 minutes, but that is not a problem. To Arnhem Max 15 minutes wait.
Official hitchhiking spot (liftershalte).
Again a good spot

It can be difficult to go from Arnhem to Nijmegen. Cars from Apeldoorn and Zwolle leave a50 to go to Nijmegen center. The go here, can easilly see you and stop. I have been Hitchhiking here a lot, never more than 30 minutes
Lot’s of people going south
It should be a good spot to go south to Maastricht, but for some reason it took me really long. I was trying to talk to people directly, but also to just stand with the sign.
Good spot. We stood at the exit of the petrol station with a sign that said "Venlo/Eindhoven" Didn't have to wait long for a lift to the German border!
Lots of traffic heading south
Have been here over 25 times, sometimes as a starting point, usually bound for Maastricht, average wait 15 minutes, average ride length 80 kilometers. Well recommended services!
Good place if you want to get on into direction of Maastricht/Aachen.
If you want to go 'South' on the A2, and people can only bring you as far as Den Bosch, make sure they will drop you of at this place.
Got a ride to Eindhoven within 2 minutes of waiting at the exit.
Good place during the day for directions Eindhoven and Den Bosch, but during the evening its more difficult, I have been sent away once by the personel of the gasstation in the evening too.

Petrol station, not a lot of cars ... you can ask for a ride to the next petrol station or to Eindhoven ... I wanted to go to Cologne, and had to wait more than 1 hour till a car accepted to take me to the next spot ...
excellent point for amsterdam even when it's dark, easy to find a car, especially if to attract drivers' attention
Really good location to get rides for amsterdam. Cars slow down or stop before traffic light. Better if you have a sign! Good luck :)

A great place to hitch! Stand on the small ramp between where the fly-over comes down and the entry lane from the side, where both lanes stop for traffic lights. Very good place to get to Amsterdam from here.

Going towards Breda, I was here for about 30 minutes before someone stopped. Not a lot of space for drivers to pull over. 
Although there is the traffic light, so people are forced to stop. I think with a big, clear sign and some luck it could be good. 
If you're going direction Rotterdam or Amsterdam you might get away faster.

There's a few meters of emergency lane here. Cars are not officially allowed to stop, but there's some space. Seemed for us the best option for a ride to Amsterdam in this area. Waiting time was about 5-10 minutes.
If you want to go to Germany -> Now it's the time for looking for german license plates
Good spot! Even in the morning (07:30) loads of people, most of them going towards germany! Good spot for asking around, not so much for throwing up your thumb.
I was going to germany in the evening but there was nobody going to germany ,finally a guy take me to next station after arnhem to increase my chances of catching rides toward germany
NIce place where a lot of people stop to go to Germany
Service station De Buunderkamp, A12 direction Arnhem/Germany.

Asked around again.
Step by step to Germany

I didn't wait for the perfect ride, just took one that went east. 
It's not a BP station anymore so things people wrote before me might not apply anymore.

Got a ride direction amsterdam. Guys from BP told me it was forbidden to hitchhike there, I'm not sure if it's true and what they can do if you persist doing it, but I got a ride 1 min after they told me I couldn't stay there. Waited 5 min in tottal

Got told by employees that BP's company policy wants hitchhikers to ask only at the sides of the shop building. Didn't get hassled ever before here, so I'd suggest just asking in front of the building like usual. If they do bother you, you can always move away (or not...).

Petrol station Bijleveld. This is the big service station between Rotterdam/The Hague/Delft/Leiden/Zoetermeer/Gouda. 

You can find here rides towards Zwolle, Apeldoorn, Arnhem and Eindhoven/Maastricht.
God picked up by the first passerby
Friday morning, sign with Berlin and A1. Not a lot but enough cars, we were picked up by a nice person and dropped of a bit further on the A28
I couldn't find an official HH spot but I can also recommend this place. Stood there with an "A1" sign and found after a few minutes someone who brought me on that motor way.
Direction North Germany or Scandinavia. I would recommend this spot. A lot of traffic, enough space for cars to stop. Easy to reach from the city centre.
Hilversum, Amersfoort. Waterlinieweg x Van Ostadelaan. Bus 12/13s stop â€œStadionâ€, 200 m W Herculeslaan/][/Rubenslaan, 200 m S Van Ostadelaan. Official hitchhikers spot.

Was there at sunrise on a weekday. In around 25 minutes, I was offered two different rides. One in the direction of Rotterdam, and another towards a petrol station on the highway just outside of Leiden. At this hour it was all short-distance work traffic.
this is my go-to hitchhiking spot in the Hague, lots of cars leaving the Hague heading south towards Rotterdam and Belgium
most of the traffic was local. got a ride to Amsterdam in 45 mins on a monday morning
Petrol station on S107 towards A4 Amsterdam/Delft and especially A13 Rotterdam.
So quick and great spot - gas station
We were there on a busy afternoon to find a ride south. The people were kind and after 15 min we got a car to the Belgian border.

Ok place. Lady of the service station offered me a piece of cardboard, without asking. Asked some young swiss guys but they were full, did offer to take just my girlfriend though...  

Waited about an hour at 7:30am on a monday (because of the amount of local traffic) but a friendly belgium guy took us to the big service station just over the border.
Average for rides to Roosendaal/Bergen op Zoom, not much traffic, got lucky after about 30-40 minutes.
Good petrolstation but not reacheable by public transport
Got rides going to Nijmegen here twice. Also was offered rides going into Arnhem. At bus stop "Golflinks".
Great spot during rainy or stormy weather, as there's a semi-enclosed bus shelter to hide in. Got a ride to a petrol station before Zwolle in less than 10 minutes.
Traffic goes by fast. So I waited near the traffic lights end of the bus stop. Got a ride to zwolle in 10 minutes.
After only 5 min wait I got a ride all the way to Zwolle
At the busstop Golflinks, to A50 (Apeldoorn, Zwolle)
Good spot for directly approaching people, especially at the electric chargers, as people have to wait there. We got a ride to Zwolle after 5 mins
Petrol station Mussels to Zwolle.
A gasstation with most people moving down the A12 to utrecht or the A20 to rotterdam
Took me a whole of five minutes to find a ride all the way to Utrecht (or close anyway since I needed to get further). Very good spot.
We managed to get a guy going to Delft and he was so nice that he took us straight to our direction Wageningen. There are nice people here :)
First gas station in Netherlands
Altough a very busy place and didnt expect anyone to want to stop here, I got a ride in 4 minutes. Driver took me a bit further that he needed to go.
Just around the corner there is a small bridge to wait.
Breda, (Bergen op Zoom), (Antwerpen), (Oosterhout).
Driver saw me walking in the berm to this place and already stopped because he though I was a hitchhiker.
Good spot at the traffic lights towards Tilburg.
unfriendly staff at the gas station - not alowing to talk to drivers and hitchhike only at the exit

Petrol station Romeinse Put. 

Good for rides towards Arnhem / Nijmegen.
Getting here does require to cross a few busy lanes but the spot is great!
Ramp A15 towards Rotterdam/R'dam, accessible via parallel road.

22 km before amsterdam. Easy to find a ride to the right area in amsterdam. To Haarlem, Alkmaar and Den Helder is possible too, but amsterdam is soeasy, it might be a good idea to wait for the perfect destination inside amsterdam

Petrol station Ruwiel.

Obviously very easy to Amsterdam, harder to Hoofddorp, Alkmaar and Hoorn (but should be doable), very hard to Almere.
Did not get a ride before the bus came after 20 minutes. It looks like a good spot, but nobody stopped.
Also good spot if you want to visit the island Schiermonnikoog. Use the sign with the name of the island and the visitors of the island (every year some 300 000 people) can give you a ride
N361 in direction Winsum. Seems like a good spot, right at the bus stop.
A lot of local traffic leaving the highway too soon, but if you look for German plates you can get far into Germany
Great hh spot to go directly to Germany/Berlin etc.

Keep pushing the pedestrian crossing button to force drivers to stop. They can turn into the carpool parking. 
Used sign "Zutphen". Got dropped at the station with 5 minutes before my train left.
Direction Amersfoort/Arnhem. Decent spot with a lot more space to stop than the other spot a bit further down the road. I still had to wait quite a while but I guess it was just bad luck.
If you go to Nijmegen and someone can drop you off (and continue on the highway), this is a good place. A sign ‘nijmegen’ will help you, cars stop and being you to the center.
To Nijmegen. Exit 1a of A73, 200 m E N326 (Wijchense weg). Parking lane.
Just when we got off, we directly found a new hitchhiker to Apeldoorn. It did not take more then 2 minutes, incredible!
Petrol station Hogewei. Rides to Nijmegen, Arnhem, Apeldoorn are the most likely to find here.
Took a short ride to the official "liftershalte" in Nijmegen (Graafseweg, Keizer Karel).

Gas station on A325 direction Nijmegen, Eindhoven, Den Bosch, Venlo, Antwerp.

Quite good starting point from Arnhem, many people continuing toward Den Bosch and Eindhoven.
Not a bad spot, but the hard shoulder is quite small and therefore it is quite hard for drivers in the lane going directly from the petrol station to stop.

Petrol station Ooijendonk. Quite well frequented by drivers. The best directions from here are Utrecht / Amsterdam / The Hauge. 

To Nijmegen or Waalwijk will be much harder, but there are some good spots around 's-Hertogenbosch for these directions.
First person I asked
Petrol station Bisde. Most cars will go towards ´s-Hertogenbosch and further, some towards Nijmegen.
AMAZING PLACE! Loads of ppl going to Belgium very easy to get lifts
A gas station.
Quite a busy gas station for the size. Everyone is going into Belgium or France. Took us 5 minutes to find a car heading to Ghent.
Petrol station De Beerze, A67 towards Antwerpen.

Gas station right before A1. One of us thumbed while the other one talked to cars at station. Most cars going local; one said could take us to Apeldoorn.
Had sign; got a ride straight to Utrecht from thumbing.
We waited here for a very short time and eventually decided to move to the highway entrance where the cars could see us better.
Amersfoort, (Utrecht, Amsterdam), Almelo (Enschede, Germany)Deventerweg, fuel station (BP). Bus 56 & 81 stop 'Zweedsestraat'
Perfect spot. Lot space for the cars to stop, enough traffic. I easily got a ride to Utrecht.
First time for me here in southern direction, 3min waiting to get a ride to Amsterdam. Seems almost as good as Zwolle-Centrum.
On-ramp 20 Zwolle-Noord, A28 towards Amersfoort, Utrecht. Hard shoulder and slow traffic.

Caught a ride to Heerlen in about 15 minutes here, but that distance might have been a bit lucky,

I also got a ride to Krefeld (A77, Germany) here in about 20 minutes, so the place seems to be fine for both directions.
Petrol station Lokkant. Very good to Venlo, good to Maastricht/Heerlen. Also OK probably towards Gogh / Weeze Airport.

Still construction, also moved a few 100m like gbimbel—didn’t get a ride. Seems unsafe to get people to stop on the emergency lane as people use it. When construction is done, the bus station should be accessible again and this will return to being a good spot
due to the construction the spot isn't active as of summer '25, but 200m down the road works just as well
Really bad for Boxmeer nowadays; hardly anyone following Maps drives like this
Getting a direct ride to Breda is easy from this spot (n=2)
Easy spot in direction of Eindhoven (December 2015, 15 minutes, single male, sign) or Den Bosch (July 2010, <5 minutes, mixed couple, sign)
Always a good place towards Oldenzaal or to nearby servicestation on A1 (direction Germany) both with sign Oldenzaal. Hard shoulder for cars to stop. Waiting time during day most times 10-30 min.
I walked here from the A35 oframp because I had no confidence of finding a ride going east there. It paid of after 18minutes. Could use a sign "Lonnekemeer" for the next gas station.

take this to the next petrol station. most of the trafics are local and i is hard to take a long ride, but in a few kilometers there is the last petrol station in Netherlands, where you can find a long, direct ride to any city in Germany on that way.

on-ramp 30 Hengelo on the A1, direction Oldenzaal/Germany. Even though the spot is really good, with a hard shoulder, waiting times can be really long in this direction because traffic is mostly local and think they can't help you... Still advisable spot though, because the last service station in NL is 6km from here.
Ukranian truck driver picked me up and drove me almost to the German border. Very easy, just go up to people.
Fine, just like all the gas stations on the A1.
Got really lucky and found a ride going east with the first car I asked, took less than 30 seconds!

Tankstation \"Lucasgat\", not much traffic because 20km before already is a tankstation.But some people going to Apeldoorn/Deventer! But take a look on the sign at the end of the parking area ;) Waited round 40min there.
I got a lift very quickly at this location, could be due to the time Friday evening/afternoon

At the on ramp after the traffic lights. Not much room before the motorway sign, but there is space after it for a car to stop.

Not a very safe position, but effective, if you have to start from this area
Quick ride to Den Haag, petrol station/restaurant easily accessible from the street and public transport.
Seems to be a very crowded petrol station, with lots of cars for direction Rotterdam.
Service station Bodegraven, A12 direction Den Haag / Rotterdam.
It looks dangerous to me to walk all the way up there. You'll have to walk on a road section where cars reach 80km/h without proper space for a pedestrian.
^ ^ ^ in Holland hitch-hiking on access lane is never a problem, if there is place to stop (emergency lane at the beginning of the access lane).

Good place fot the direction Venlo! Walk all the way to the end of the road till the 90 degree turn, there cars can stop quite easily. Officially its illegal to stand there though, since you pass the highway sign on your way there, but I never have had trouble!

Had a sign saying "Utrecht / Amersfoort"
Took me 20 min to find a belgium couple who even made a detour to bring me directly at my final destination "Zeewolde" on their way to go north of the Netherlands.
Lots and lots of cars!
Patrol station Hazeldonk for direction north to Breda (Rotterdam, Utrecht)
Easy to get you more in to the Netherlands
20 minute wait time, ok amount of traffic. Plenty of space for cars.
Great place to hitchhike. Got a ride in 10 minutes on Monday early evening (around 6 pm) to Emmen Netherlands. Heaps of cars and trucks (Dutch and German ones) stop here to rest and fill a tank.
We just waited for 20 mins and got a ride, an apple, and a banana to Amsterdam. Lots of traffic but no luck on trucks because of the insurance issue.
got a car to Alkmaar in 20 mins ish, good place
I tried to catch something to Hoorn 2 times and I did it,  it's ok place.
Stayed here twice: Leeuwarden and Alkmaar. Both times got a lift in less than 15 minutes.
Alkmaar, Zaandam, (Leeuwarden). A10 access lane S102.	 Train station â€œSloterdijkâ€, 200 m E Hatostraat, 250 m N La Guardiaweg, 250 m E Basisweg, cross.	 Bus lane on sliproad.
Good if you want to reach to paris or that direction

Found this place to be more or less pointless going south, most drivers passing here are going (south)west towards Eindhoven/Den Bosch. 

For direction Venlo, your chances are much better next to the onramp to the A73. I've hitched many times there, always works great. 

Furthermore, the above statement is supported by the fact that you can clearly see how many drivers coming from the Wijchenseweg are entering the A73 direction south there: they weren't many. Of the total amount of cars entering
Or reach this gas station with bus 3 or 4 to Wijchen. Get out at busstop "Streekweg" and walk by the Praxis, through the tunnel.

to Venlo

you reach the place with the train (Nijmegen Dukenburg)
got a ride from the 3rd person we asked. while we were waiting for his tesla to charge, a police squad blocked the motorway and arrested a guy in the petrol station. very entertaining. good spot!
Very nice weather today!!!
Ride to Antwerp in 15min, but probably got a bit lucky.
You can take bus 195 from Jaarbeursplein, exit at Overwaard and walk to the patrol station.
Petrol station IJsselstein. To 's-Hertogenbosch or Breda.
Little traffic but never takes long to get picked up. Once got taken to Luxembourg. Today to Gent
Got a ride to Antwerp in 40 minutes on a Saturday. Not much but enough traffic.
I got a ride to Antwerp after 25 min. Big gasstation, but not too much traffic.
We got a ride to Antwerp after 15 minutes.
Good spot to get dropped off, easy to get a ride towards Antwerp or Brussels.
Very quickly made my way from Wageningen to Leuven. I got a straight ride with a Belgian couple to Leuven as they were heading to Charleroi.
Got a direct ride to Maastricht (155km) in 14 minutes. Two other hitchhikers the same day got a ride to Maastricht just after they left their previous vehicle.

I was heading to Antwerp, so I asked people if they drove to Eindhoven to get from there to Antwerp. Some people drove to Nijmegen and the person who gave me a ride drove to the gas station behind Breda, which is better than Eindhoven, but less obvious.
Had a hard time here, doesn't seem to be too crowded. Still a good option I think.

Petrol station Weerbroek. 

Easy to Eindhoven. Venlo and 's-Hertogenbosch should be also realistic directions.

Two hours with Belgium,Maastricht sign waiting. we were boy and a girl and not one stopped for us, there is no too much traffic. We were lucky because a guy was passing by we showed the panel, he did no with his head than I said thank you in Arabic ( because he looked like an Arab) so he took us till Masstricht. we were really lucky because it looked like a really bad spot
Three and half hours with a sign Venlo. At the very end some woman took me in southern direction and dropped me on next petrol station on A2.
Had a ride to Maastricht very quickly.

Petrol station Velder. Many drivers are going to Eindhoven. Direction Maastricht is easy to get here, towards Venlo is less easy but possible. Antwerpen is hard but you can change the car for Antwerpen in Eindhoven, best at the exit Veldhoven or Waalre (these exits are located on the side motorway!).
Good for rides East, some Germans. A lot of people goi,g towards almelo, fewer to Arnhem
Good spot for going East towards Germany and Arnhem
Still seems to be a good spot. Got a hitch across the german border in no time, but I might got lucky
I biked to Fort Vechten and left my bike there for 4 days. It is a really short walk to the gas station from there. I got picked up in 20 minutes by a man who went to Oberhausen :)
it is a busy gas station so easy to find a ride towards arnhem. lot of local people though, it just gave me a ride to the next gas station
Great stop to leave Rotterdam, many cars stopped but heading all over the place. In the end we got ride to Nieuw-Vennep.
Going to Leiden and most people were going Amsterdam. Eventually found a couple going back home. Definitely asking is the way at the station
Adding to my previous comment, I approached people directly at the gas station (no signs or whatsoever). Worked really well.
Excellent for getting a ride straight to Amsterdam. Less than 5 minutes.
Good!!
Good place for going south (apeldoorn/arnhem). This traffic light on the ramp is gone. During rush hour the cars drive way too fast to stop here. Try to ask people at the trafficlight on the bridge
Okay for going south, I had to wait for around an hour. 2 other guys joined me and then we got a ride all the way to Venray. I think I lacked their charm haha.
Use this spot regualar, workdays morning and afternoon are the best
Greath spot ! i use it regualy to go to Utrecht or Apeldoorn

Sunday late afternoon, hardly any traffic, not much space to pull over - got a ride in three minutes :) 
Great spot!
Literally got from one car into the next. Ride took me to near Gouda (was asking for the direction of Leiden)
5 minutes to Amsterdam
Sign/asking 'Den Haag' had no success, asking around for Utrecht is better!
This gas station is pretty large, you can easily find rides to Utrecht, Rotterdam, The Hague etc.
Great spot to hitchhike out of Amsterdam towards Utrecht. Walk up next to the highway ramp and then there is a wide shoulder. Had a big sign and waited only 3 minutes.

Can be a good spot, you need to go up the ramp in front of the highway sign. Behind there is a place for cars to stop. Definitely use a sign with "Utrecht" otherwise local cars will stop. Don't stay at the corner by the traffic lights there is no place to stop. Stand there for like 50 minutes - only one local ride. After going further up the ramp got a ride after around 15 minutes. 
A lot of traffic even on Saturday afternoon.
Super good! Got a direct ride to Utrecht after only 5 minutes!!
Got a ride to Utrecht after 35 minutes, more or less. A lot of cars passing by, but seems that they don't give a shit.
This spot doesn't seems to be the best option in the northeast direction. I have been waiting here for a lift in direction to Groningen for more than one hour

We got picked up by nice locals on the way to antwerp !
Write a big sign and wait before the petrol station and hope for the best!!

Started hitchiking here on a Tuesday at about 8am. Just ask the cars if they are going direction Goes. Got a ride within 5 minutes to the gasstation at Arnemuiden. Here traffic from Middelburg as well as Vlissingen passes by.
1 hr wait only brought me as far as a petrol station just outside Goes.

Our starting point to get to Ghent, we were standing close to the gas station (on the gas station itself it's not allowed) with a sign "Terneuzen." Even though Zeeland is quite difficult to hitchhike, this is quite a good place for going to Vlissingen or Terneuzen and beyond.
Recently a new road has been constructed, and some of the traffic from the city might actually go straight on this road, and won't pass this spot anymore.
Perfect spot.

good spot for hitching tot Heerlen en Maastricht, perhaps in stages
I got already three times a ride along the A2 to direction Heerlen you can drop of at Het Anker servicestation near Susteren
got away within 20  min. on average
stand on the pavement at the beginning of the busstop, cars can stop at the busstop
The classic spot for Maastricht and Heerlen directions, also drivers to Venlo and Antwerpen.

Hitchhiked from here about a week ago. The fuel station doesn't help you as everyone stopping there will go towards Eindhoven. The spot is good for thumb-hitchhiking towards Weert, Roermond, Maastricht and Heerlen. This spot is not advised if you want to go to Belgium/Heerlen, then you should search for a spot on the Aalsterweg, which is west of this road, or if you can find a way to go there, to the fuel station on the side of the highway A67 between Eindhoven and Eersel.

Excellent spot for the directions of Maastricht or Germany. I hitchhiked from here lots of times and almost always got a ride in <15 minutes. For the direction of Antwerpen, rather take the spot at the Aalsterweg!
Didn't take long, the driver only picked me up because she had hitchhiked in her younger years. I had a sign saying 'Den Haag'

It took 20 minutes to get a lift to Den Haag with sign. 2 people. 
Driver told us that this place is illegal to hitchhike, but we don't know. This place is on the bus stop.
Waited 30 minutes with a Belgium sign, then I switched to a Den Haag sign and someone took me within 5 minutes. Very good spot overall
Two backpackers (boy and girl) got a 20 km ride towards DenHaag after 45 minutes wait. Felt very confidence in this spot, and probably could get a better ride.
Got a ride to Delft in 10 seconds
We got pick up in les than 2 minutes with a sign for Almere. To get out of the city good spot!
Official hitchhiking spot but well...at least on our day, everyone was going just around. In the end we made sign Muiden and a car took us away from this place

If you go east, direction Amersfoort, make a sign with Almere. Many people go there, they can bring you to Muiden gas station, on the right highway to Amersfoort just before they leave to highway to almere
Cars are moving quite fast, but there's room to pull over and I got a short ride out of the city to a filling station very quickly.
GREAT spot defo worth going there if going towards Germany.

Got a good ride to the next service station.
But one dickhead showed me his beautiful middle finger. I love the dutch friendliness :)
location sounds cool but cars pass by fast and they cant see you!!
I stayed an hour and no pickup
Perfect spot to hh to Belgium. Did it couple of times (alone and couple with girl) and works pretty fine. Less than 10 minutes both. Sign "Belgium" or "Antwerpen".
Really good spot, get a quick lift to Amersfoort
Hard to get there because of bushes. Very good spot. We were going to Nijmegen and I took only 10mins

5min waiting to catch a car direction Utrecht. 
We were two persons without a sign, the only inconvenient is walking by the highway and you can get problems with police if they will see you
Went here on a dry day, was perfectly accesible on a save distance from the highway. Got a hitchike to Eindhoven within 15 minutes

Ive been there after it rained & was walking on that day in the rain. Just watch were you step, pretty simple. Having trekking boots on would be the best option but to be honest, I had no trouble getting dirty. On the way, its a bit dangerous some spots walking beside the road but some other you have few meters in-between. No worries, no trouble. As the other people wrote in the comment too which i would agree, just a bit of a pity to wait for longer as there are not many cars drop-in but all wh

I was there 8 or 9 June 2013, and station was closed for some maintenance, so i walked almost 15-20km to south to find another spot ;) 
It's forbidden for pedestrians to walk here from the city, but we were ok. You need to go through the bushes, so after a rain it could be a problem.
you can target people going to utrecht by either set of traffic lights with regular success
great spot! going south, got a ride from a guy that used to hitchhike from this spot to all of europe back in the 80's. stand in the middle part so the cars going straight to the A2 can pick you up.
buena opción para salir de amsterdann en dirección a belgica, dure 2 minutos para que me llevaran a la estación de servicio antes de llegar a Utrech, solo tengan un cartel que diga a donde van.
We were putting our backpacks down to lift our thumbs up that we got a ride :D
After 5 min waiting we were taken directy to Eindhoven. Very good place.
No one would even acknowledge me or stop and ask
Good spot pretty easy to reach by foot. The cars have enough space to stop. Waited 20mn for a ride for 2 persons to Breda with a “Breda / België” sign.
Lovely lady took us to just outside Brussels. Only waited 5 minutes and didn’t even have our sign written up yet.

Still a good spot to go east. I was driven from a local hitchhiker to this spot, he told me that most of the cars drive from here through the A12 (A1 pretty rarely) and it didn't tooked me long and a woman drove me to the first patrolstation wich is surprisingly near

Got a ride to a good gas station before the crossing of A15 and A27 north of Gorinchem. Besides, on the pole of the sign we  found the names of two hitchhikers that we invited to our house in a tiny village in Norway as they were on their way to Bergen :)
We waited for a while and asked around but most people go to the border (and thats a tough spot to get out)
Great spot towards the border. We just started asking people in the morning and a couple took us to the border.

I got very lucky on a early Saturday morning in December.

I took bus 5 to Scharmer here and walked across the bridge to get to the gas station,
there was only a very narrow and slippery plank across the ditch though, so it is quite hard to reach.

But I got lucky and got a ride all the way to Bremen from here.
it can take a while but if you're lucky you will find a ride to hamburg directly

Got really unlucky on this station. 7 years of hitch-hiking and it's the first time that it happens to me. The guy of the gas station came and said that it's illegal to hitch-hike, that i should go on the parking more far. There was almost no one on this day, so i said that it's legal and that i will stay here anyway. The guy spend the 2 hours that i was here saying to people to not take me. Finally he got bored and i got a ride. Crazy!
Lot of cars but not easy to find one even by asking everyone
Me and my friend (two guys) got a ride to Hengelo right from here in 30 min (it was it was at noon). Not so much traffic here, but you can ask people on the gas station and parking.
staff of gas station tells you to go to the parking lot occasionally
We got a ride to Germany after 10 minutes but we were lucky.
My friend got a ride from here to Hamburg within 20 minutes.
Good spot for directly approaching people, especially at the electric chargers, as people have to wait there. We got a ride to Hoevelaken after maybe 10 mins

We asked many people, but many went to Amersfoort or Harderwijk (A28). We needed to go to Arnhem (A50). We drove off after 40 minutes for a 50 minute drive to Arnhem. They asked us! Not something you see often. Lovely family.
Most cars went south or to Zwolle, but at the end i found a car to Rotterdam
Got a ride to Amersfoort in about ten minutes. There is a small place where you can be seen by people parking and tanking.
Would rather be dropped off at Zwolle-Noord or Centrum, but if your ride only goes to exit Ommen then this gas station is good.
Early Saturday: got a ride to Twello (A1 toward Germany, March '13). Also lots of traffic to Utrecht and Amsterdam.

Direction West (Utrecht, Amsterdam) and North (Apeldoorn, Zwolle): Total gas station

You can talk to people here for getting a ride. Many of them take the A12, but some also go north on the A50.
Hard to find how to get to this gas station (there is small path from Oude Venloseveg). But place is good, many cars
About 40min walk from the city center.Rather small service area but busy. Good spots to hitch at the exit. There is a (tiny) fence around but as well a place to enter.
Eindhoven in 15mins
Trucks and Cars
Just a good spot, didnt find a bus stop, but enough place to stop
Great for rides to wageningen. Bus stop available where cars can stop. Decent amount of traffic
First I had a sign to the A2 but that did not work so I changed it to A58 and got a ride in 5 minutes
If you stand at exit of the petrol station you can stop as well the cars on the road.
many people stop at the BP before going on the highway, usually works very well,even in the dark because it has lights.

had a couple of times a good ride from here  in different direction in NL and even into Belgium
some personel will send you away here
useally you stand the best past the shopbuilding just before where cars enter the road again

a better place is propably the busstop some 300-400 m back towards the big T-crossing , there is a busstop, the former officially hitchhikespot
Nice spot towards Hoogeveen/Zwolle, not that much traffic but got i ride in 30 minutes to Zwolle from here. From Emmen take bus 43 to Koriander in Klazienaveen and walk back to this spot.

We went there at night to reach Zwolle, after police took us to the train station north of there. However, it was almost empty until 5 am(1-2 drivers between 2 am and 5 am), but workers there were very nice. At the end we finally found someone who lifted us
Gas station on the A32 towards Heerenveen and Zwolle. Can also be used to hitch rides in the direction of Almere, Amsterdam and Utrecht.
Nobody was going south so i got a ride into centre of Rotterdam to try somewhere else to get to Breda
15 min to find a car further south on the highway
Depends on where you're going. It took about 1,5 hrs to get a ride to Breda. Most traffic was going to Rotterdam.

Waited about 20-25 minutes. Got a ride to the centre of Nijmegen. Next day the third car stopped. Got a ride to the beginning of Nijmegen. There is a parking were you can talk to people which will not be necessary.
To Nijmegen / Arnhem.
Nice spot to find a ride towards the bridge over the A1. From there, you can walk to the nearby gas station and get a ride to Germany
In the direction of the highway there is a parking just after the traffic lights. Get your cardboard at the Lidl around the corner.

Arnhem, Groningen, Enschede. Fuel station on A27 between access lane 28 and access lane 29 â€œDe Knoestâ€ (7 km). Bus 65 stop â€œDrenthehavenâ€ (Nieuwegein), 200 m S Hollandhaven, 1800 m SE Weg van de Binnenvaart / Waterliniedok, bridge over the motorway. 45 mins. Fuel station on the motorway. Es.

Good spot going south. Easy to catch a ride to Nijmegen and possibly to the A73 going further south or the A50 towards Eindhoven. Easily reachable from Wageningen or other neighboring towns by taking the bus to the stop “Patrimoniumweg” and walking down along the Kerkweg. The ramp is accessible shortly after exiting the tunnel.

Southbound; lots of traffic towards Nijmegen coming from Wageningen. Easy to get rides to Nijmegen here, ask if you can be dropped off at petrol station a few kilometres down the road if you need to get further afield.

gas station on the way to the higway A4. good for De Haag, Rotterdam, anything south. 
there is a bus lane for cars to stop, too.
Waited an hour for a ride direction Den Bosch/Eindhoven. Eventually walked to the onramp and got a ride right away.
At the bus stop. Got a ride to Nijmegen. This place should at least get you to the A73.

Not much traffic on a saturday, but only waited 3 minutes. Lady took a detour to drop me where I needed to go. 
Stand just in front of the bus stop so people can pull into the side street. Alternativly, try the crossing Grevengoedlaan x Haareweg for probably some more traffic.

I tried this spot, it’s a good one, especially because when I was there the road in the other direction was under construction so all cars entering the roundabout were bound to go south. Got picked up by the first car who saw me with my thumb

I didn't try hitchhiking here yet, but it looks like a decent hitchhiking spot : enough space, cars are driving quite slow, good visibility for both you and the driver. Maybe not so much traffic on some points of the day.
To Doetinchem

Catching all traffic to the A4 motorway from the south part of Leiden. At his spot, the traffic is speeding up from 50 km/h to 80 km/h, but there is enough place to stop on the exit lane to a small parking lot.
Very good spot if u are travelling to Kleve.
Going tothe train station after a hike

Stood somewhere else first for 3/4 hour, then a man reccomended this spot. Stood by the road and got pickud up quite quickly, bit hectic though so close to the road, so maybe a bit further is better. Straight to amsterdam though :))))

I actually preferred this spot over the restaurant parking lots nearby.
When I was there, the parking lots were pretty empty but there was traffic on the road. There is a bus stop where cars can easily pull over right before the highway to different directions. Had a sign that said Leiden, my ride would only have gone to Alphen but ended up taking me the whole way to Leiden Central Station. Surprisingly good spot. Even though it was already 9pm.
Not really a solid spot, but didnt have to wait long for a ride to Lelystad
Not very pedestrian-friendly. Got a ride in 1 minute.
Drove the car of a German couple that had just been checked by police and had an expired license.
Real visible, but not many cars that drive to Gouda stops on a station just before Gouda. I was lucky guy worked there. But as a last resort, really pleasant.
probably the best spot to go from Rotterdam to Den Haag or Amsterdam. Waited maybe 25-35 min

Had one driver promise me he'd come back to bring me to Enschede in 10 mins,  but I already had a ride before that. 
At the bus stop. Bit awkward with the curve of the road being blocked from view by traffic signs so I stood quite far on the road.
Good spot to hitchhike towards Amsterdam.
Relatively good spot to get to Eidam or Hoorn. Or on the other side to Amsterdam.
Great spot if you need to go to (northern) leiden from the direction of Amsterdam. The exit of Leiden itself is a bad to spot to hitchhike and quite far from the city.
we got a ride pretty quickly. Drivers can stop at the gas station.
Third time using this spot to get out of Dordrecht direction south. Normally takes me 15 minutes to get to the highway, this morning took me one hour.
Enough space. Almost all traffic comes from the south.
When searching for a hitchhike towards germany this is a great location
It took longer for me to walk here from my accommodation than to get a ride.
Good visibility, but not a lot of traffic. Most drivers seem to go in the direction of Deventer. If you are trying to get to Arnhem, go to the next exit (24) and trying there, that worked for me.
Not heaps of traffic through here but I quickly got a ride straight to Liege.
Very quiet sunday evening. Not a bad spot though.
Find someone who is dropping people off and hope they are leaving utrecht, lots of people with full cars and not leaving the city.
Some nice couple toked us to Musstricht😍
I believe this is a good spot as cars have to stop at the red light, it’s a bus stop and if they really stop cars from behind can go on the other lane. Found a car that brought me to Germany
Haven´t tried, but the two on-ramps near here actually look pretty hitchable.
Huge traffic jam
Bus station to go from Harmelen to the train in Woerden.
Not perfect but in consideration of missing alternatives okay. one bay midday
Parking bay on the N18.
We were two girls. The driver was super nice, we wanted to get to Rotterdam because there was no train working that day, he brought us to a metro station in his town.
Good for the direction of Nijmegen
Wanted to go to the highway to the west. Nice place to stop and it was dry.
At the begining of the bus stop. Probably better to be dropped off one stop later though.

Try to stop the cars at the traffic light.
We got a car very quick to the next gas station.
Safe spot, good visibility, most traffic appears to go in the direction of the train station. For going towards Middelburg, a sign may help
Straight in to Tilburg
It was raining and early in the morning

a lot of germans here (at least on Saturday, when I was here) that can take you to the German highway. There's a gas station where you can directly ask people, but my sign was enough to get picked up within minutes
There weren't a lot of drivers, but I still got a ride to Nijmegen within 10 minutes
We waited on the side of the roundabout with a sign A4 ruygen

One of the best places to go North from Eindhoven. You can ask at the petrol station, but I stood here many times just a bit before the petrol station and then cars can stop easily (although some drive quite fast)
This is quite a good spot to go North. not the busiest but cars drive slow and there is plenty of space to stop.
Get dropped off at the FBK stadion. Hitched at the zebra-crossing with a sign "A1". Got a ride in 15 minutes.
Many ppl go local, but rides across the afslutdijk and to texel are available. Check the dumpster!
It was rainy, so I found a guy that agreed to give a ride till the center of Maastricht. But even in peak hour it's not that much cars.

Bus stop direction east to Wageningen, close to Rhenen trainstation (train to/from Utrecht). Cars drive slowly and can easily stop at the bus stop. The bus to Wageningen didn't go, so I put my thumb in the air, got a ride to Wageningen almost instantly once the traffic lights turned green.

I waited like 20mins for a ride, this is a nice place.the bus stop is nearby too so if you ask the bus driver nicely its free. but this is a kiss and ride stop. with the directions too Heerhugowaard/Alkmaar or Middenmeer/Afsluitdijk (going to Friesland)

Okay spot, but not very great.
Best to ask around, I stood at the end of both ways to catch all the cars leaving the spot. Got a ride that went to Hamburg but I got off before Osnabrück
First German car we (2F) approached headed for direction Hamburg
Only local traffic. We were even lucky to catch a hitchhike to the next petrol station
Took us to brockbachtal gas station near osnabruck. Good spot, we saw dutch, german, danish and belgian number plates in July
10 min. from MCdonnalds. the guys were going to HAMBURG.
hard to reach spot by a traffic light, you can try and ask people who stop.
wasted 1h at the other spot by the gas station, here I got picked up quickly on a Tuesday afternoon
Got a ride with Brussels sign to Brecht in 5min
Hitched a ride to Brussels in 20 minutes, stood by the highway sign
Space for cars to pull over, 20 minute to get a direct ride to Antwerpen.

After I saw the comments I thought it will be an easy spot. But I just met allot of locals that stop after here or trucks that are just waiting hours for someone. Also remember that trucks will not take you with them before the border- you are a risk for them if you have something illegal. After 15 minutes asking everyone on this spot a campervan took me with them. Crossing the border was luckily really chill.

Not a lot of people heading to Germany; still one of the best spots to hitchhike east from Groningen. Try avoiding the A7-A28(0) route if coming from elsewhere in the Netherlands, the route via Hengelo (A1-A30) is a lot more busy.
Not really crowded, got after 45 min a ride to Oldenburg
Not so crowded, but I guess if you stop a car it's going far.
From this gas station I got a few hikes and arrived in Berlin within six hours.

Waited 15 minutes. We're about to turn around to go further south and walk to julianaplein. Then we heard 2 cars, took one more try. One stopped, they saw my blue jacket together with the sign and thumbs and took us al the way to Zwolle. they had to go to Amersfoort. Arguably the best spot for leaving Groningen. Have one stand at left Emmasingel side (west) to talk to the drivers and one with the signs to Stationsweg (east) as a tip (worked last time)

I disagree with the people saying not to use a sign; there are countless directions the cars are heading towards (Drachten/Assen/Hoogezand/Emmen/etc.) and people are more likely to stop if they know where you're heading. My waiting times with a sign (towards Assen) are about 50% shorter than without one.

Great spot outside of rush hour (waiting times usually below 10 minutes), average in the afternoon/early evening (took me more than half an hour to get a short ride, apparently commuters aren't too keen on hitchhikers).

Direction Amsterdam: after waiting for over 2 hours with no luck, we decided to move to the entrance of the highway and we got a lift in 10 minutes. Might work better for other directions, in those 2 hours 2 cars stopped going to nearby villages

15 minutes and going to the Meppel.
Great spot. Few cars was stopped at this spot. Hitch without a SIGN!
Go up the grassy bit onto the hard shoulder of the on ramp, multiple people stopped and asked where they could take me.
Really nice spot, real visible and as someone said, lot of space for cars to stop. But be careful, you’re practically on a highway.
Great towards Den Haag
Lots of place to stop/stand, got a ride to a petrol station at junction A12/N11 after 10 minutes.

Den Haag, Rotterdam,  (Breda), ('s-Hertogenbosch). A12 access lane 17	. Bus 47/64 or sneltram stop â€œKanaleneiland-Zuid, â€¦â€, 200 m S Europalaan (sign â€œforbidden for pedestriansâ€ near access lane). Hard shoulder on sliproad.

Got away very quickly but also very lucky.
Only a ride to the next big gas station (with MacDonald's) under Holten
Many cars were going to neighbouring towns. It was very hard to even leave the petrol station, so we just took a hitchhiker to the next petrol station
Small gas station, but the next (bigger) one is quite close with not much in between, so it's pretty easy to catch a ride there.
Pretty small, but you'll always catch a ride to the next, much bigger petrol station (near Holten).
Not too much traffic (March '13), but got lucky and caught a ride all the way to the center of Berlin!
Man leaving macDonalds beeped at me on his way home from work to Tilburg and agreed to drop me in Breda.
Took around 30 minutes on a Saturday morning to get on the highway to Breda.
good place, rainy day got a car to Anwerpen in 30 minutes
Lots of traffic towards Breda.
Near entrance the motorway in the direction of Belgium, beside a large gas station and Mc Donalds. The cars are driving slowly because of the roundabout and have plenty of space to stop.
Took me 20 minutes to get a ride to a gas station south
Two times. Good place, one time a bus took me. :)
Got a lift to Rotterdam in 10 15 mins :)
Stood at bus stop.  Hitched towards Leiden (with sign "Leiden"), good weather, 5 minutes).
(Leiden). N44 (Benoordenhoutseweg) x Boslaan. 300 m NE Bezuidenhoutseweg, 500 m NW Utrechtsebaan (A12) / Boslaan, 100 m E N44 (Benoordenhoutseweg)	. Bus lane.
Do not recomend. Dangerous spot, not possible to reach on foot.

Almost impossible reaching this spot theese days without walking on or through the wild or highway. Thinking about the police review I wont recommend this spot as long you don't feel totally adventurous
Direction: DE ... It was a holiday and the only ride we got was from the cops. No ticket, but wouldn't return. Still, they did give us a 20 minute ride out of town :) Thanks officers!
Also perfect to go north (Groningen & Leeuwarden)
a off-duty busdriver took us and another dude waiting with us (no charge), said he does this regularly. As we could use the 'spits-strook' we skipped all the traffic jam :)
Mostly local traffic
The gas station is not too busy but we found a ride to the next gas station in 10 minutes.
30 minutes for a lift to Antwerp, easy spot.
Very good place to hitchhike from. Anyone passing here goes either to Eersel, the rest towards Belgium (Turnhout, Antwerp).

Used this stop in January 2013.
After one hour we've found couple from Spain who were going to Antwerp. Then we have had a lunch with them.
Unfortunately we've lost their contacts :(
Utrecht (Den Haag, Den Bosch, Breda). A28 access lane 3. Hard shoulder on sliproad.
first car passing by stopped and took me to Gulpen even though he was only going to Margraten.

Gulpen,
(Aachen). Akersteenweg. Bus 53/54 stop â€œAkersteenweg/Oude Molenwegâ€. (300 m W Akersteenweg). Bus stop, Fuel station
(Parking lane).
Petrol station De Sprang. Directions Rotterdam, Breda, Antwerpen, Bergen op Zoom.
I was just warned not to hitchhike In area's that weren't officially reachable by pedestrians
Onramp 23, A15 - Direction Rotterdam (Den Haag)
The road was changed. Cars can only stop bij pulling over to a parallel road. So, I prefered a location closer to the A4 motorway.

Got a ride to Amsterdam after 30 seconds by just sticking my thumb out.
I was standing just behind a traffic light where a lot of cars stop and have enough time to see you and can relatively safely pull over on a parking lane.

My standard spot to leave, as i live next to it. Pretty fine, just use a sign with the highway number and direction. When going to Utrecht or Apeldoorn the 'carpoolplaats A12 Arnhem noord' is a great first step

Immediately picked up by some older gentlemen who used to be hitchhikers. They said this was a bad spot, so drove me to a better spot (a highway ramp by zevenaar).

It is no exaggeration to say I was picked up immediately, so for me it could not have been a better location. But according to them, two locals, it was not ideal.
A lot of local traffic. Eventually, a girl who was heading to Apeldoorn drove me to a gas station on the A50 towards Nijmegen. Thank you very much!
Also fine for direction Germany, with a sign.
Good for Nijmegen, average for Apeldoorn, Utrecht, Rotterdam.
I gave up after 30min but it should be doable. Not great visibility (curve), cars are rather fast and not much space to stop.

Direction: South
Place: On the small strip between the roads. 
Got a ride in 10 min.
Best place to stand if you want to go south from this entrance of motorway.
Got a ride to Amsterdam quite easily there...

Good place to get a ride in any direction.
Walking distance from the airport.
a bit dangerous, since its on the highway, but pretty much ur only good option out of maastricht if u wanna go south.  a guy dropped me at the gas station in eisjden, then got a ride in 2 mins.

Not a legal spot to hitchhike according to the traffic cop who picked me up after drivers apparently called the police on me. Drivers constantly beeping and yelling at me, one guy even through a beer can at me.  
Luckily the cop drove me to a nearby truck stop just to get me off the highway. I would try a different spot heading south next time
Really dengerous spot…but good
they were waving but didint want to take us, then the guy showed up and took us to gas station (shell) and it went really great up there
Was able to get to Liege quickly from here with a sign, plenty of space for people to pull over.
First car that saw us took us to Eindhoven
Got a ride from here to Amsterdam

Just the average dutch service station, there is some car and truck traffic through here. I got lucky at the exit to the highway. Cars are not too fast there yet and everybody can see you there and stop. Recommended.
Highway service station "Meiberg" on the A2/E25 towards Eindhoven. The parking lot on the other side of the highway is called "Roevenpeel".
Seems a good spot but with the police station just in front it changes everything. We where told to move of the spot just 2 minutes after arriving…

Plenty of space to stop. Especially good for direction Amersfoort (A1) & Utrecht (A2).
Easy to reach by tram 26
Much traffic in direction of Tilburg / 's Hertogenbosch. We wanted to go in direction of Apeldoorn, we were already satisfied with the next town 'Veghel'
1 girl, direction to Amsterdam. waiting time 20min
20min on a Sunday evening (9.15pm) for a ride to Enschede.

Shell service station along J F Kennedylaan. Some space at the exit of the station to hitch cars along the road as well as cars filling up gas. Lots of local traffic on inner lane, though possible for cars to stop going direction Nijmegen, Tilburg or Amsterdam.
Official hitchhiking spot (Liftershalte).
We stood just after the turn leaving the roundabout, stood for maybe 5 minutes!
We stood some meters further away from the roundabout, just behind the crossing. Maybe a better place to be seen and stop, but who knows. Got a lift to the next gas-station near A73.
Venlo, â€˜s-Hertogenbosch	. N326 (Graafseweg) x Keizer Karelplein	300 m E Van Schaeck Mathonsingel, 50 m S Keizer Kareplein	. Official hitchhikers spot (most often in use as car parking).
Ok spot going to A1 entrances. Use thumb or sign 'Borne'. Stand at begin of hard shoulder between road and cycling path. Waiting average 15-45min
At the moment the petrol station is under construction so I continued to the train station to get to Groningen without trying hitchhiking
not a bad place with friendly staff
Not a lot of traffic, but good visibility and lots of place for cars to stop
I hitchhiked here a few times. Good spot. Good visibility and a lot of place to stop, but for some reason always had to wait some time here

Waited over an hour at the bus stop next to this place but nobody stopped so I decided to go to this less legal spot in order not to miss half the cars going in the direction of highway. After less than half an hour a guy stopped that was not even going to Amsterdam but said that he doesn't have anything to do and brought me right to the city center while pointing out all the main attractions along the way.

Fantastic spot! Except… nobody picked us up. Maybe someone else will have better luck?
Bus stop right before a stoplight. Tons of cars coming from Keukenhof Gardens. Can talk to drivers stopped in long lines from traffic light. Everyone I talked to was going opposite direction from Amsterdam even though all traffic to Amsterdam must pass that spot. Only one person actually pulled over and stopped for us, but she was going a different route.
After over an hour we looked at bus options. An unmar
This place was a story, we waited for another time and there was and on the other traffic and also the police woman stopped us because it was illegal to hitchhike there
Spot is quite good. Cars have the place to stop for you. Also enough people coming.

i was saying here about 14 minutes.
the girl took me to the border.
There's enough room for cars to pull over, in the direction of Hoogezand / Germany.
Great spot to get east, directions Hoogezand / Germany. From the circular way around Groningen people will be directed on the highway via the Europaweg.
BEWARE!! Gasstation is closed because the connection to the A15 will be here.The parking might still be open, Check before you go here.
Pretty good gas station to get to Germany, probably the best option you've got coming from Arnhem or elsewhere in the region. Plenty of people, as mentioned above, to at least Hünxe.

Not very good petrol station, no restaurant. We were here on Wednesday at 7 am going to Germany. At this hour not many cars stopped here, some trucks on the parking. After 1 h we found a guy going to Cologne.
Quite easy to get a ride to Hünxe, last petrol station before the Ruhrgebiet from where you can try to hop over that petrol station thin area.
Service station Oudbroeken, A12 direction Germany. Less German cars than you'd expect, but not that hard to catch a ride to the Ruhrgebiet.

Ok spot, hard shoulder is too far away from standing point before highway sign and entrance is 2 lanes. But cars stop anyway on road or in grass next to road. I always get away with sign 'Deventer' and hop off at servicestation A1 near Holten. Or sign 'Almelo' to travel on A35/N35. Waiting 30-60min.

Don't really understand the bad ratings, got a ride from here in 10 seconds, from a truck. Slow traffic and a wide shoulder to let them stop. You could even ask at the traffic lights which have been placed really convenient.
Almelo, Deventer, (Apeldoorn). A1 access lane 30. Hitchhike from the spot close to the center. Hard shoulder on sliproad.

Asked around, and some people were willing to help, but weren't going the right direction. After 20min found someone going direction of Amsterdam, who dropped me on a great resting spot/petrol station next to the highway there.
I got lucky today, hitched a ride immediately to my destination (south towards the A27)

Just before the on-ramp back onto the highway, the traffic flows from both sides of the petrol station merge. Traffic wil diverge near Amersfoort, but going south (Utrecht) or west (Amsterdam/Rotterdam) is doable.

Very small gas station, didn't get as much traffic as an average gas station, but it was okay. It's just before the highway junction, so you can change to the A28 here or stick to the A1. I didn't have to wait all that long for a ride towards Hilversum. Also got an offer towards Utrecht
If you are already on your way, better get off at the previous station. At the end I got lucky, but I was really afraid I will get stuck.

Service station De Middelaar, A1 towards Amersfoort / Amsterdam.
Doesn't seem like such a good spot with another service station just a few km before this one, but actually it attracts quite a few cars!
Wanting to go to Heeze, I could take both the A67 and A2, so I used sign "6km". Got a ride to the next exit near Leende in 7 mins.
Weert, Venlo. A2 access lane 33. Bus 171/172 stop â€œMotelâ€, 600 m S Aalsterweg ][ A2/A67, cross. Hard shoulder on sliproad.
Doetinchem. N314 (Den Elterweg) x IJsselweg. Bus 82 stop "Den Elter". Bus stop.
The spot still looks decent but there's now a "stopping forbidden" sign right in front of it.
Utrecht, Almere, Lelystad, (Amsterdam), (â€™s-Hertogenbosch), (Breda). A27 access lane 33. Train station â€œHilversum Sportparkâ€, 750 m SE. Hard shoulder on sliproad

Theres some little space where cars can stop, definitely stamd with a big sign and somewhere really visible, dont try to be a "surprise" to the cars. Might be more difficult if theres peak traffic but it worked.
All the way to Amsterdam :D
We were waiting there for like hour, then we moved to the nearest spot. I really dont reco
Not enough space for cars to stop, esspecialy when the traffic is on peak... Spend there about one hour with my girlfriend and nobody stopped...

Good spot for direction to Utrech,Arnheim or even to Germany.
I used this spot for a several times and it is working well. The huge building and bridge gives good shelter for rain and sun. And it is the middle of the city!
Great spot. Came here at 07.15 AM to get with work traffic. We stood here for 15-20 min and got a ride to Apeldoorn. Make sure people can notice you from across the intersection.
The lay-out of the road changed: the bus stops moved to the middle of the road and they removed the bus stop on the sides. You can stand there but cars cannot pull over anymore...

I wait 3 hours under a cold wind and dark clouds. And it was a sunday. So bad experience, but It still the best spot: Everybody drive slowly, and there is lot of space to stop and chat enough to explain your trip. Smile and wait, good luck ! I needed 7 hours to arrive at Hamburg (again, in bad conditions)
Winschoten, Veendam, Germany. Europaweg x Griffeweg. Bus 9/73/776 stop â€œSontweg/Europawegâ€. Or 1000 m E/NE Stationsweg/Zuiderpark/Trompweg, 250 m NE Griffeweg.	Bus stop.

My final hike in this trip: A very nice Holland man came up to me (oh magic) and offered me the lift to Haag, but I prefered waiting a lift to Amsterdan, and he changed his route and dropped me at Bussum, and I blackrode the train to central station in the late afternoon, guessed everybody was offwork, sorry)... and there is wifi here

Had to wait for over an hour, then decided to ask around, and managed to hitch a ride to Zeist. It wasn't a bad spot per se, bigger gasstations are just more preferable, also the bathroom here was shit. (Aparently this was once rated the dirtiest gasstation of the Netherlands).

Got dropped here many times, it's not really my favourite and I prefer hitchhiking from the exit lane in the center of amersfoort. My shortest wait was 5 minutes for direction den haag, but quite a few times I had to wait for almost one hour.
For a ride to Breda/Antwerp it took about 45 minutes, but we were offered different rides to Utrecht or Amsterdam. So it depends where you're heading.

When we got off here employees immediately told us we couldn't ask for rides in front of the shop and had to stand at the exit. Because it was snowing we were asking people anyway and didn't get bothered by the staff for that. Something to keep in mind though...

Was hitching to Germany and came to this spot after not much luck at the popular lifthalte spot at Amstel Station. Got picked up by a kind couple here after about 30 minutes.
Enough space for cars to stop just before the highway sign, good for getting on the A1
Space to stop, traffics quite slow but they seemed to ignore me. Monday between 10:30 and noon
I went to to spot and the POLICE picked me up to another place to hitchhike next to AMSTERDAM AMSTEL train station.
Spot is SAFE.
I always use this spot to leave Amsterdam in direction Germany. Cars are slower than at the official HH spot at Amstelstation.
