Had a good interaction with the staff but maybe we got lucky. Got a lift with a young Dutch guy going to cologne. Overall was pretty good for us

*The employees don't like hitchhikers here. So don't stand right in front the store as a tip.* Nevertheless, we asked about 50+ cars in 50 minutes maybe even more. Many people just barely going over the border (like Kleve or 's-Heerenberg, Netherlands) or the cars are already full with people. Right as we got told by the employees to stop asking people for a ride. We just got one 2 minutes before al the way to the center of Köln. 140km/90 minute ride. Another group of friends got at this shell a

The guy at the tank station asked us not to stand at the front which is not ideal. Also not a lot of cars because the tank station is in the Netherlands and the gas prices are higher. And people where very blunt and rude here. Would not recommend
Shell gas station. The staff asked me to not hitchhike in front of the station but allowed me to try it at the back of the building. Not ideal...
Got a very quick ride heading to Cologne here in the summer of '13.
Got a ride from a nice lady all the way down to Limburg
Didn't have have any problems with the staff. One even offered us stuff to make a sign of where we wanted to go. Got a ride to the next gas station behind Eindhoven in about 30 minutes.
Unfriendly anti-hitchhiker (anti-social...) staff here on one occasion (out of four). I recommend not to feel intimidated and do as you would like to do: asking for rides.

took me hours sometimes to get away here, never had problem with the staff because I would stand next to the building where cars pass by when leaving the station
I never walk betweem the pumps because dangerous and staff will not allow this
stand here next to the shopbuilding
As said before, the guys there don't want you to stand on the station's property, so you can't talk to the custommers. Had to spend the night there in a tent.
Wait next to the traffic lights for the cars that turn right

Where the cars wait to turn right before the bridge, it took 5 minutes until a ride to the Heerijn huge petrol station before Utrecht. And from there it was 5 minutes before a lift to Antwerp. On a tuesday afternoon

Cars can take you while waiting to turn right on traffic lights but they stop for a short moment so if you have some baggage it's better to go on the other side of intersection (Rijnstraat) where's enough place to stop cars safely
it took me 5-10 minutes to get a ride to the big breukelen petrol station on a saturday morning.
Utrecht, Eindhoven.	Utrechtsebrug, start A2 Tram 25 stop â€œHunzestraatâ€, 250 m E President Kennedylaan. Traffic lights.

Has a rest area and a gas station. After trying some things I got a petty lift from a couple who were chilling there. Pretty good lift because it took me to Breda. (I think people didn't take me because my sign said Belgium and they don't understand that they don't have to bring me all the way)
This place is not busy at all, but I got a ride to Antwerp after only 15 mins by thumbing at the very exit of the gas station.

We took this spot after reading the description above, we kind of underestimated the time it took to get here. Leaving Utrecht Centraal at 9.50 we got our first hitch to the A2 at about 11.15, dropping us off at A2 petrol station/burgerking ' De Lucht'.
I think it's not the best starting spot if you want to take the A2.
Also, we were sent away from the petrol station...

Breda, Eindhoven, (Antwerpen). Fuel station on A27 between access lane 28 and access lane 29 â€œDe Kroonâ€ (7 km)	. Bus 65 stop â€œDrenthehavenâ€ (Nieuwegein), 200 m S Hollandhaven, 1500 m SE Weg van de Binnenvaart / Waterliniedok. 45 mins. Fuel station on the motorway. Ws.
I live here, you can't hitch here no space to stop... Go to hitching spot near amstelstation instead
(Utrecht). A10 access lane S112. Tram 9 stop â€œBrinkstraatâ€, 150 m SE Brinkstraat. Hard shoulder on sliproad.
Its an good Place to get on the Highway to Amsterdam. The people on the Right lane have to stop every Minute because of the Traffic lights and then you can ask them
Hengelo, Almelo, Deventer, (Utrecht).	A1 access lane 33	. Bus 60/62 stop â€œElsmorsâ€, 250 m S Enschedesestraat	. Hard shoulder on sliproad.
standing in front of the bus entrance
Alkmaar, Beverwijk, (Den Helder). N203 (Provincialeweg) x Brandweer. Bus 69 stop â€œLeliestraatâ€ (Koog aan de Zaan). 	Bus stop.
Road changed after major road constructions in 2024, comments from 2018 no longer valid
Direction Amsterdam, lovely Dutch people always take you :)

Direction Amsterdam: After waiting over 2 hours at the official HH spot, we moved here and got a ride in 10 minutes. Before the traffic light there is a large shoulder where cars can stop, and they slow down because of the traffic light. Only downside is that I'm not sure if it's a legal place, since it might be after the sign of the highway
You aren't allowed to HH here, local government forces send us away. There is a bus stop 100m to the west where we got a ride within 20 minutes to Tilburg.
Busy spot in the grass near the road. Enough space for drivers to stop on hard shoulder.

A busy road, so good for hitchhiking, but most of the traffic will go to Rotterdam and not further so the traffic that is able to give you a hike to for example Dordrecht is sparse.
Also last time I was kicked away by the petrol station owner for asking the tanking people (even though I always smile, wish people a good journey and are dressed pretty neat) but a sign at the parking lot behind the station also worked out OK :)

Gas station on south side of N280 (de facto a highway), toward Germany, but also connected toward Roermond.

Tried here for ages, also on the sliproad toward Roermond, but no luck for 4 hours.
First time I had to give up hitchhiking after a good start from Düsseldorf.

Don't go there! I got mistaken by the only good review here, but it's hopeless. There's no place to stop for cars there and practically no traffic. After staying here for 2 hours 3 police cars came for me and gave me 175 euros fine for hitchhiking on highway, but they gave me a ride to the next petrol station. My the most expensive ride so far -_-

Waited around 30-45 minutes with a sign which read 'Italy'. Created a lot of laughs, and eventually picked up a ride offering to take me to a raststätte along my preferred highway.  

Stood at the beginning of the onramp. There is also a traffic light onto it, which increases the amount of time people can see you. Also enough space for a car to stop.
Waited for 120 minites couldn't we couldn't get a ride.
We got droppen of here direction A1 to berlin, there isn't really a place to stand so we ended up walking to another spot.
Great place to hitch. The cars cannot see you while they wait in front of the traffic lights because of some bushes, but the have plenty of space to stop after they see you. Got a ride in 5 mins.
A lot of local traffic at the gas station. Ended up thumbing down a car at the on ramp. Pretty good space to pull over, but not great visibility.
Bit of a wait but was able to hitch a ride towards Leeuwarden. There is a p+r here as well
I guess, I took all my luck for the whole for this ride. Try it only on a lucky day!
Lots of traffice heading all around, cars can stop easily. We just tried it and after half hour a guy took us to better spot in Rotterdam

Medium spot. On daytime quite some traffic. Cars from the right side passing by quite quickly. Took about 20 min for someone (going another direction) to stop to tell me that its not the perfect spot to get people going to Amsterdam. But after 30 min a former hitchhiker picked me up. He went an extra detour for me to drop me at the gas station "The Schaars" on A12 which he knew was a good spot. From there just one car to Amsterdam.

Tried the entry to the gas station first but people turning left on the N11 are already sorted to the left lane so it's harder for them to pull in. So I moved to the middle berm just before the traffic lights with sign "A12". Told my driver he could drop me at the gas station on the N11 near Bodegraven, but he insisted on taking me to the next one on the A12.

Expected more from this place. Maybey I should have used a sign. Stood in the berm before the gas station to give people time to react. Declined 4 rides going only to Groenlo before taking one there anyway. There I only waited 2minutes so should have doen that right away.

Not sure how good this spot is as the person who picked us up went quite far out of his way to bring us to a service station on the A2. Fairly busy in a morning, not too much traffic actually going out of Amsterdam.
I believe this is a decent spot, but I gave up after 34 minutes when the bus came.
Easy to get a ride into Eindhoven, not so much for going further. Eventualy accepted a ride to Eindhoven and got stuck there.
Found out the gas station isn't reachable on foot so went to this bus stop instead. Got offered rides to "Duiven" and "Arnhem zuid" before accepting a ride to gas station "Kempke" on the A325.
At the beginning I was not standing in the gas station but on the main road (formore than 1hour, without any car stopping).

You have to be lucky. Not a lot of traffic. We asked first women and we got a lift to Kapellen (Belgium).
2 people.
No good spot to stop, but quite some cars taking the N11 coming from the A12 west
here a lot of people go to the highway towards Germany, not a very comfy place but one of the best around lol...
July, 2023. Saturday 10 a.m.

Camping store Obelink. 
There is no place to stand on the side going to Aalten/Doetinchem but I still had a ride in 3 min by standing on the paralel road with a sign. 

If the store is open it should be quite easy getting a ride to Doetinchem, or Germany by asking at the parking.
Took long to get a ride direction A1 eastward. 2 males. Police sent us away when we waited on the nearby highway onramp direction barneveld
Took me 30 min to get a car in direction to Arnhem a saturday afternoon
Took me about 30 minutes to get a car in direction Amsterdam on a Saturday afternoon.

Gas station with both cars for direction Apeldoorn (if you need that: GOOD spot) and Amsterdam (average spot). Get bus 76 to Bunschoten and get off at the bus stop before the gas station (something with "Zeldertse...") and then walk to the station.
Badddd spot not very loads of local traffic. Got told it was half German cars but not really. Got a lift from a trade van not far down the road to a better spot

We had got a message just before we got here. To go to Köln, Germany. We thought it was a good idea to be next to the A12 (South. Except everyone is going to Arnhem (North) or Dieren etc (East/A348). We settled for a 5 minute ride to Zevenaar to be on the A12.
I stood at the entrance just where the guardrail stops, with thumb and a sign "Doetinchem"

Difficult spot for direction Germany, but probably one of the best options in Arnhem. You should try to hitch a ride from someone who goes onto the A12 until at least exit 29 (Zevenaar) so they can drop you off at service station Oudbroeken, which works much better.

Good spot for getting a ride east into Germany, but tricky to get to by foot. 

From the intersection of Lange Water/N325 you have to walk along the verge of the N325. When I did this, August '12, the grass was more than 1 meter high with loads of cobwebs and stinging plants. Also, it just takes quite a while to walk.
Second truck i asked. (I asked trucks because there where few cars.)
Hardly any traffic.
Petrol station named OK. On Friday evening almost empty, if there were some cars, mostly just local traffic. Even the highway seems to be almost empty, especially in the direction to the south.
Waited 30 min, after which someone stopped to tell us no one goes to Amsterdam from here and took us to the train station

Direction: Highway
Got no ride after 30 min, while quite some traffic.
One person stopped, but went in another direction.

There's a bus stop on the onramp. I being a sunday meant not to much traffic so my driver could make a late decision and reverse back onto the bus lane. On week days this place might be a bit harder to get out of. I would still try though.

Firstly, this place stinks because there is the AVR is an incinerator so you smell rubbish the whole time. Secondly, barely somebody pulls over. When I stood there 2 minutes, a girl stopped, but she drove for just 2 km, so I thought somebody else will stop. Not at all I decided to walk to the intersection of the A12 and the A348. Another option is to take the bus to Arnhem which stops at the ramp.
It's ok spot. A lot of traffic and place to stop

I got a ride pretty quickly. Would agree that the spot might not be perfect — not that much traffic unless you go to the roundabout. Also, the people stopping at McDonalds seem to be going in other directions than Amsterdam. My luck came from the direction of the hotel, where someone was heading towards the city.

Worst case there is a train station close to it, so you can easily get into the city if you are not lucky.

It was in the evening and despite a lot of cars, no one gave me a ride to Amsterdam. Lots of families and probably a lot of people tend to go in the other direction at night.
Usually it is very easy for me to get rides in the Netherlands, so this place is really bad somehow.
Luckily there is a train station right next to it (it does have gates)
No place to pull over. Gave up after 2 minutes. Didn't feel safe.

Three minutes in working afternoon to Den Bosch. 

No hard line.
Mild traffic, construction (May, 2008) makes pulling over difficult but doable. Waited 15 minutes with light traffic on a Saturday morning, heading north to Utrecht.

At the end it always works to go from here to Nijmegen.
